title: Elon Musk says Tesla is building an ‘armored personnel carrier from the future’
text:
Elon Musk has big plans for Tesla’s new pickup (Reuters)

Elon Musk has called Tesla’s upcoming pickup truck an ‘armored personnel carrier from the future’.

The tech mogul was responding to a question on Twitter about potential designs for the upcoming truck that have been floating around the internet.

When asked if any of the designs come close to what the electric car company has planned, Musk responded:

‘Cybertruck doesn’t look like anything I’ve seen bouncing around the Internet,’ he said.

‘It’s closer to an armored personnel carrier from the future.’

Cybertruck doesn’t look like anything I’ve seen bouncing around the Internet. It’s closer to an armored personnel carrier from the future. — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) October 14, 2019

The all-electric pickup that Tesla is working on – clearly dubbed the ‘Cybertruck’ here – is set to be revealed at some point in November. It’s part of a range of new vehicles the company is working on now that its mass-market Tesla Model 3 is up and running.

Alongside the pickup are plans for the Tesla Semi, which could eventually tackle long-range haulage, and a new version of the sporty Roadster.

Tesla is rumoured to be revealing its electric pickup truck in November (Reuters)

As to what an armoured personnel carrier from the future actually looks like, we’re not sure. But the grand statement serves to generate hype among the Tesla faithful ahead of the product’s eventual reveal. In the past, Musk has suggested that the Tesla pickup truck will have a range of anything from 400 to 500 miles on a single charge.
